item.title: Big-O Notation
item.description: Defination f(n) = O(g(n)) or f(n) ≤ g(n) if there exist constants N and c, n ≥ N , f(n) ≥ c*g(n) Common Rule Multiplcative constants can be omitted **n^3** = O(**n^3**) **n^2**/3 = O(**n^2**) n^a < n^b for 0 < a <b : n = O(n^2), root(n) = O(n) **using n for a and n for b n^a < b^n (a>0,b>1) : n^5 = O(root(2^n), n^100 = O(1.
